Package simulation

Class PendingEventContainer

  • java.lang.Object
    • simulation.PendingEventContainer
  • public class PendingEventContainer
extends java.lang.Object
    Implements a pending event container, where Events can be added and accessed/triggered by temporal order.
    Author:
    group16

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      PendingEventContainer()
      Empty constructor for pending event container.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      void add​(Event newEvent)
      Add new pending event.
      void deleteAllInvalid()
      Delete all the pending events that are marked as no longer valid, due to, for example, an exception.
      int eventsTriggered()
      Get the number of events triggered until this moment.
      boolean isEmpty()
      Checks if there is any event pending to happen.
      double nextTime()
      Returns the trigger time of the next pending event.
      boolean triggerNext()
      Trigger the next event, if any is available and the next is valid

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Method Detail

      • isEmpty

        public boolean isEmpty()
        Checks if there is any event pending to happen.
        Returns:
        true if there is any pending event, false otherwise.

        Returns the trigger time of the next pending event.
        Returns:

      • triggerNext

        public boolean triggerNext()
        Trigger the next event, if any is available and the next is valid
        Returns:
        true if an event was triggered
